alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 8:32PM EST until January 19 at 7:18AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Halifax and Northampton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Tarboro. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, The Riverside Park and River Road at the US64 bridge flood. At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins south of Daniel Street in east Tarboro. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 7.4 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Tar River Tarboro 19.0 21.8 Wed 7 pm EST 19.1 13.3 10.3 8.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 845 AM EST.
